meanings.definition: An extremely easy task or accomplishment.
meanings.sent1: Finishing the puzzle was a cinch for the young child.
meanings.sent2: Walking in the park is a cinch for me.
meanings.sent3: Eating the whole cake in one sitting would be a cinch!
meanings.sent4: Winning the race was a cinch for the champion runner.
meanings.sent5: Remembering her phone number is a cinch for him.

meanings.definition: A strap or belt used to secure a saddle on a horse.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy tightened the cinch before riding the horse.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the cinch is secure before you start riding.
meanings.sent3: The horse tried to chew on the cinch during the ride.
meanings.sent4: The worn-out cinch snapped suddenly during the ride.
meanings.sent5: The leather cinch was beautifully crafted and decorated.

meanings.sent1: She cinched her backpack tightly before hiking.
meanings.sent2: He cinched the rope around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The chef cinched the apron around his waist.
meanings.sent4: The team cinched the victory with a last-minute goal.
meanings.sent5: The lock cinched shut, trapping the keys inside.
